question: What is Saturation index?
exp: Langlier saturation index indicates degree of saturation of Ca. CO3 in water Used in industry to stabilize water. LSI is based on 1) pH of water 2) Total dissolved solids 3) Alkalinity 4) Calcium concentration 5) water temperature - LI positive - it leads to deposition & scaling - LI negative - it leads to corrosion - LI should be kept zero - to avoid corrosion & scaling

question: Recommended minimum amount of Residual chlorine in drinking water is
exp: Free / Residual chlorine act | Chlorine + water | It combines with impurities and Sestroyes them by formation of hypochlorous acid | Which causes 90% of disinfection | After all impurities are destroyed we leave some Extra chlorine in the water | So that water remains safe and clean to drink for next 24 - 48 hrs. | This additional chlorine is known as free or residual chlorine Recommendation free residual chlorine - In drinking water >= 0. 5 mg /L (ppm) - In swimming pools >= 1. 0 mg / L - For killing cyclops >= 2. 0 mg / L Chloroscope is use to estimate free / residual chlorine level - Test used is ohotulidire test

question: Median Incubation period means:-
exp: Median incubation period - Time taken for 50% of cases to occur. Incubation period - Time interval b/w entry of organism into body till appearance of 1st signs & symptoms. Serial Interval - Time interval b/w primary & secondary case. Generation time - time interval between entry of organism into body till its maximum infectivity. Latent period - Time interval b/w onset of disease till its first detection. It is corresponding term to incubation period for non-communicable diseases.
opa: Time taken for 50% cases to occur
opb: Time between primary case and secondary case
opc: Time between onset of infection and period of maximum infectivity
